thread.title: At least 12 critically injured after car plows into New Orleans parade crowd - police — RT America
thread.title_full: At least 12 critically injured after car plows into New Orleans parade crowd - police — RT America

title: At least 12 critically injured after car plows into New Orleans parade crowd - police — RT America
text:
At least 12 critically injured after car plows into New Orleans parade crowd - police Published time: 26 Feb, 2017 02:30 Edited time: 26 Feb, 2017 02:39 Get short URL FILE PHOTO © Sean Gardner / AFP At least 12 people are in “critical condition,” with more feared injured after a truck crashed into a dense crowd of participants of the Endymion parade in New Orleans, police said. 
"Initial reports show so far about a dozen people are in critical condition," New Orleans police said in a statement. 
According to local media outlet The Advocate, up to 21 people have been injured as a result. Breaking: #Neworleans police investigating a crash where a vehicle ran into a crowd of people. A dozen are in critical condition. pic.twitter.com/1J2tKu1XvI — Laura Podesta (@LauraPodesta7) February 26, 2017 
The car, described by eyewitnesses as a “silver truck,” apparently collided with another vehicle, then plowed into the crowd. 
The incident occurred at 6:45pm local time at the junction of Orleans and North Carrollton avenues, WVUE reported. 
Kourtney McKinnis, an eyewitness to the incident, told the Advocate that the driver appeared unable to comprehend his actions. 
"He was just kind of out of it," she told the outlet. 
Official now also assume the driver was drunk. 
“We suspect that this subject was highly intoxicated, he is in custody and is being investigated right now,” Michael S. Harrison, superintendent of the New Orleans Police Department, told a press conference. 
The ages of the injured are ranging from 3-4 years old to about 40 years old, the official announced.
